item.title: Help me please
item.dc:creator: @bladex_demon bladex demon
item.description:
@bladex_demon wrote:

first off, i have already answered your first question today you can find it at: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,459091.msg3359035.html#msg3359035
which you asked. Second of all, to add customs like a death cape you will have to download its model and add it in your “models” folder (in your “client folder” to get its model simply use the search button and search for it…once that is done you will need to add its “ints” into “class8.java” above or below one of your items ints. an items ints will look like this"

if(i == 8100){ class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 0; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 0; class8.anInt174 = 10099;//item look // class8.anInt181 = 1957; class8.anInt190 = 498; class8.anInt198 = 484; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 10098; // class8.anInt200 = 10098; // class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Saradomin Sword "; class8.aByteArray178 = "A blessed sword used by the saradomin god kree'arra.".getBytes(); }

To find a particular items ints i suggest you use the search button for this as well…
any more info you may require towards using models can be found at: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,363483.0.html
this leads to a great tutorial made specifically for modeling.
hope you learnt something from this and i answered your questions :).

Read full topic
